meanings.definition: The quality or state of being foolish or eccentric.
meanings.sent1: Her pottiness was evident in the way she wore mismatched socks to work.
meanings.sent2: His pottiness often led him to make decisions that others found strange.
meanings.sent3: The pottiness of the situation made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The pottiness of his ideas was like a colorful painting in a black and white world.
meanings.sent5: The pottiness of the clown's performance left the audience in stitches.

meanings.definition: The act of behaving in a silly or irrational manner.
meanings.sent1: The children's pottiness during recess made the teachers smile.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but join in the pottiness of the group dance.
meanings.sent3: Their pottiness at the party was contagious, spreading joy to all.
meanings.sent4: The pottiness of their game of tag turned the backyard into a magical kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The pottiness of the comedy show had the audience roaring with laughter.
